name: Shakshuka
title: Shakshuka
instructions: Cut the ends off the aubergine; dice into ~2cm cubes and put in a bowl.
Preheat a saucepan on medium heat.
When the pan is hot, add 1 tbsp of olive oil to the pan and coat the bottom.
Add the onion and stir regularly. 3-4 minutes until it's soft.
Add to the onions: garlic, 1 tsp paprika, 1/2 tsp cumin, 1 pinch cayenne pepper. Cook and stir ~30 seconds.
Add the aubergine cubes, add 1/2 tsp salt and 1/4 tsp of black pepper. Cook, stir occasionally for 6-8 minutes until the aubergine is soft.
Add the chopped tomatoes and stir. Simmer for 5-6 minutes.
Shave the coriander leaves off the stems with a knife; throw away the stems; finely chop the leaves.
Stir 3/4 of the coriander into the pan.
Create 4 small gaps in the tomato/aubergine mix and crack an egg into each of the gaps.
Season the eggs with 1/4 tsp salt and 1/8 black pepper.
Bring the heat down to low, cover the pan. Cook until the whites of the eggs are set and the yolks are runny. 5-7 minutes.
Crumble the feta cheese into a bowl
Take the cover off the pan; sprinkle the feta and remaining coriander over the shakshuka.
Ready to serve :) Bring the pan to the table, rest on a board and serve with bread. Drizzle some olive oil over your serving for some added flavour!
